# direction

**Instance Property**

The direction in which information flowed to or from the device.

## Declaration

```swift
var direction: INInteractionDirection { get set }
```

## Discussion

Use this property to convey whether the interaction involved information moving to or from the current device. For example, starting a video call from this device indicates an outgoing interaction, which means you should set this property to [doc://com.apple.sirikit/documentation/Intents/INInteractionDirection/outgoing]. The default value of this property is [doc://com.apple.sirikit/documentation/Intents/INInteractionDirection/unspecified].

## Accessing Interaction Attributes

- **intentHandlingStatus**: The current state of the interaction.
- **dateInterval**: The time at which the interaction started and its duration.
- **identifier**: The unique identifier of the interaction.
- **groupIdentifier**: The unique identifier of the interaction’s group.
